content: Warning, I am a foreign policy realist. If you don't know what that means, go look it up. Israel's national security is not ours. Yes, they are a democracy with whom we have long historical ties. But we do not actually have a formalized alliance with them. Indeed there have been less than friendly episodes between us, but then that's a fact between most countries, even allies. We do not formally owe them anything, though I'm sure we would step in if they were attacked and at least offer some assistance. Israel has nukes. It has a flexible and workable government. It has the best air force and the best ground forces in the region, bar none. It is technologically heads above any other taker out there, including Iran. It has a functional economy. No one is going to launch a nuclear weapon at Israel, regardless of all their talk about wiping them off the face of the map. It's not going to happen. They would be annihilated. Iran is a little crazy, but it's not suicidal. I hope Israel does not pre-emptively strike. The strait of Hormuz being cut off, and the generally rattling concept of missiles and bombs and fighter jets all over the region, would likely spike oil prices up to the point that this little recession we might be seeing the end of will become rather a longer one, what with no one able to ship much of anything for a few months due to the costs. As far as Islamicists taking over, and actually establishing a caliphate?? Them and what army? Even IF (GOD FORBID, FORBID) they managed to blow up a few more high rises and military facilities, would our government really surrender and raise the crescent flag over the White House and Capital? (Some of you may be deluded enough about Obama to believe this to be possible....) We are made of sterner stuff than that. Quit fearing things, guys.

content: quote: Originally posted by psychoABN: Oh really? If we're not going to insure their survival, what the hell do they owe us? Iran has said several times what they'd do with the first nuke they get, and our wise President said to give them another six months so that "diplomacy" could work. Makes us look soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo weak. YES WE CAN.....turn into a pansy nation......overnight. As far as foreign policy goes, we are now a laughing stock. I can understand Israel being nervous, but you think that because they now have a long-range missile we should nuke them? Heck, even W gave Saddam time for diplomacy - Congress (****-wits that they are) approved the invasion in Oct 2002 but we didn't invade until Mar 2003, 5+ months later. Was that okay, bearing in mind that this was still not nearly enough time to get anything right? I agree that the typical negotiation will not work - these countries figured out a long time ago how lucrative it was developing weapons and then demanding money to stand down. There cannot be a carrot here, only a stick. Pansy nation? Really? In whose eyes? Which other nations are sitting there going "heck, we'd do it if we just had the resources!" And if you think THIS makes our foreign policy a lauching stock, I cannot imagine what international news sources you have been viewing the last 8 years.

content: Warning, I am a foreign policy realist. If you don't know what that means, go look it up. Israel's national security is not ours. Yes, they are a democracy with whom we have long historical ties. But we do not actually have a formalized alliance with them. Indeed there have been less than friendly episodes between us, but then that's a fact between most countries, even allies. We do not formally owe them anything, though I'm sure we would step in if they were attacked and at least offer some assistance. Israel has nukes. It has a flexible and workable government. It has the best air force and the best ground forces in the region, bar none. It is technologically heads above any other taker out there, including Iran. It has a functional economy. No one is going to launch a nuclear weapon at Israel, regardless of all their talk about wiping them off the face of the map. It's not going to happen. They would be annihilated. Iran is a little crazy, but it's not suicidal. I hope Israel does not pre-emptively strike. The strait of Hormuz being cut off, and the generally rattling concept of missiles and bombs and fighter jets all over the region, would likely spike oil prices up to the point that this little recession we might be seeing the end of will become rather a longer one, what with no one able to ship much of anything for a few months due to the costs. As far as Islamicists taking over, and actually establishing a caliphate?? Them and what army? Even IF (GOD FORBID, FORBID) they managed to blow up a few more high rises and military facilities, would our government really surrender and raise the crescent flag over the White House and Capital? (Some of you may be deluded enough about Obama to believe this to be possible....) We are made of sterner stuff than that. Quit fearing things, guys.
